cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with multiterminal source coding problems, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. The use of an entropy-based distortion measure suggests a connection to information theory and compression, which further supports the likelihood of cs.IT. The paper also mentions lossless distributed source coding (Slepian-Wolf) and source coding with side information (Ahlswede-K\""{o}rner-Wyner), which are both topics studied in the information theory and data structures (cs.DS) sub-categories. Finally, the paper may also be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category, as it deals with the optimization of a distortion measure.
